txt.en: Collected buckets of fish  ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collected buckets of fish  ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The Angmarim have driven polar bears into the fishing-grounds of the Lossoth.

'For many generations, my family has fished in the Ice Bay, and the spirits of the water have always brought to us a great bounty of fish. I am worried now, though, for my livelihood is being threatened by the Rauta-väki.  

'They have come hunting the kantâ for meat, and that has driven them closer and closer to the fishing-grounds that once were free from such danger. It has become so dangerous that I dare not even return to retrieve my fish!

'Go and retrieve my fish-buckets, which still lie where I left them by the shore. Be careful, though, for the bears will be after the fish as well.'
Olavi's fish-buckets can be found south-west of his camp along the Ice Bay.\n\nFearing the bears, Olavi has asked you to retrieve his fish-buckets from the fishing-grounds.
The bucket is filled to the brim with fish.
Olavi is at his fishing camp east of Sûri-kylä along the road in Jä-rannit.\n\nYou should bring the fish-buckets you recovered to Olavi.
'Have you retrieved my fish-buckets yet? They lie close to the shore, south west of here.'
'You have brought me my fish! I doubted you would be able to handle the kantâ, but now I can see that you are truly a [placeholder] of your word.'
'I would not have recovered my fish without you, [placeholder]!'
'How will I ever get my fish back?'
The bucket is filled to the brim with fish.
